While my own payoff is the same in both options, the 'Right' option provides Person A with significantly more money (750 vs. 400). Since I'm assuming that the money Person A receives will be used, at least in part, in a way that contributes to the greater good, then I am opting for the 'Right' option. Even if Person A uses the money for personal gains, the amount of personal gains that would need to happen before not choosing the 'Right' option are significant. Thus, the assumption I am making will be in alignment with my conservation values.
